review_text: Great place for a big family! We had more than enough room for our family of six.
Super communicative host! It was a little tricky to find and GPS was no help, but all in all we made it and it was such a beautiful space!

It was our 2nd time staying there. Such a great spot! Beautiful and spacious. Perfect for groups. One of our guests is now thinking it might be a great place for his family to stay when they are in town.

Beautiful lodge with comfortable accommodations and ample room to fit our large family. Adults and kids had fun and the dining room table was great for family dinners. Everyone slept comfortably and enjoyed the large kitchen. Location was quiet and peaceful-great for early morning runs!
The host was very responsive, the house was well stocked and we enjoyed our time there immensely. Highly recommend staying here!

Spacious, clean, comfortable, had everything you could need to cook, eat, drink for a large gathering. The dining room table was amazing. So nice to have a table that fit the number of people the house can hold. Zero complaints or problems which is rather unusual for a rental. Cookware and knives were in good shape/sharp. The pool table was a BIG hit. Definitely worth the drive.
Place was extremely nice and well stocked. We hope we left it clean enough, we tried. Carla was very helpful with any questions we had

Great lodge for a big group of people! It's beautiful and clean and spacious and cozy. It was a great location for going in and out of Theodore Roosevelt National Park (about an 1 hour). Well-stocked. Great family style dining and kitchen area. Great different areas for meetings/recreation/relaxation. Truly wonderful! Theodore Roosevelt National Park is absolutely incredible, highly recommend!
Great space, privacy, and the lodge has lots of cool amenities!!! Highly recommended!

My family and I came into North Dakota to visit Theodore Roosevelt national park and Medora. This was a great location to spend quality time with them and take day trips into the park.There was plenty of room for everyone and also spaces where we could gather together. This is a great property for family time.

An incredible place to unwind and enjoy the solitude of North Dakota. Easy to travel to Theodore Roosevelt National Park and enjoy it’s offerings without the rat race. Carla and her husband were gracious hosts and they have a beautiful place. Perfect for a retreat for a church group or supporters of your nonprofit organization. Highly recommend!
5 stars for sure! Great lodge for hunter but also a great getaway for slowing down and escaping the city life.
Great place, beautifully decorated and very peaceful to stay at. Lots of room for all of us!
Beautiful clean and home, hot tub was great to relax in at the end of the day. We look forward to coming back next time we are in town.
Great place to stay. I would highly recommend.

We are SO thankful Whitney lent us her beautiful home while our kitchen was being remodeled due to a water leak. It’s not easy to be living out of your home with small children, but Whitney’s place made us feel right at home! She responded quickly if we had any questions and we would 10/10 recommend to anyone looking for a place to stay in Dickinson!
Great place to stay, quiet and peaceful. The house was clean and decorated to feel like home. It was very comfortable.
We enjoyed our time and it met our needs. Didnt use the new hot tub but it was beautiful. Thanis Whitney
very nice place. very clean.
Great place and a great host. Thanks Whitney!
Great place, fantastic host.
Fantastic place. Host is very easy to communicate with.
Beautiful and very comfortable home.
Whitney's place is so nicely decorated. We had plenty of room for 6 of us and everything we needed. We used the hot tub, which was a great perk! comfortable beds.
Whitney has been fantastic to deal with. Super responsive. Couldn't ask for better communication. Loved our stay.
Great place to stay! East drive to the National Park! Beautiful home! Lots of room. Would stay there again!

Whitney is a great host! Her home was a great place to stay. Everything we needed was there for us.
And it’s so beautifully remodeled. Charming home.
This was a great home base for us for a few days as we visited Teddy Roosevelt National Park and Glendive Dinosaur and Fossil Museum in Montana.

Whitney’s place was super cute and extremely clean. All the amenities promised, including the hot tub, were working and ready for us. Great back deck. Quiet street. I wish I could hire her to be my interior designer. 😂 Highly recommend!

Whitney is an excellent host and her home is immaculate. We appreciated all of her little touches along with a terrific kitchen and lots of space.
We chose Whitney’s place as a stepping off point for the North and South Units of Teddy Roosevelt NP. We could not have been happier with our choice.
A big thanks to Whitney for making us feel so welcome. This is our first family trip since COVID. Having such a cozy and comfortable spot to share made all the difference.
Loved the hot tub, dining area, ample sleep space, and neighborhood. Felt like a local right away.
I would highly recommend staying here for anyone looking to enjoy the Dakotas.
Thanks again, Whitney!
Brian 🌿
Whitney’s place was beautiful, extremely clean, comfortable, and just simply lovely. We wished we had booked it for longer! Don’t hesitate to stay here.

Although small house the space was very efficiently used. 7 of us family were very comfortable and Whitney was very responsive to any questions. Enjoyed the hot tub which was convenient to the roomy back deck.

Beautiful home near Theodore Roosevelt National Park. We had a group of 4 adults and 2 teenagers. The house worked out great. One bedroom upstairs and 2 downstairs with a flex space downstairs that is set up as a 4th bedroom (no door but tucked around a corner downstairs so its still private) A full bathroom was located on each floor. The house is like a brand new house inside updated with Beautiful finishes. Seating for 6 in the open concept dining area. Nice deck and grill in backyard with a hot tub. The kitchen was well equipped and easy to cook meals if you wish. Near restaurants and grocery stores. Whitney was very responsive and helpful. Would highly recommend booking here. It is a great house!
Great place, would stay again. Whitney was responsive and accommodating of our late checkout times.

Whitney’s place was the absolute perfect spot for traveling around the area. Quick drive to Theodore Roosevelt National Park. Great, safe, and comfortable place to come back to after a long day of hiking. The hot tub was a lovely touch and the spaciousness was exactly what we were looking for. If this place is available, don’t bother looking elsewhere- book it right away! Hoping to come back some day. Thanks so much for hosting!
Nice place very clean and stylish. FYI for folks with kids: lots of lovely decor that they will want to touch. 😊 Very happy with our stay.
Whitney was a great host with a place that matched the description. It was centrally located to all the things we wanted to do and was clean and well equipped.

Whitney’s house is in a very quiet neighborhood and is cute and comfortable. It is one of the cleanest airbnbs I have stayed in. Communication with Whitney was great. We used it as a base for visiting Theodore Roosevelt NP and it was nice to enjoy the hot tub after a day of hiking.
A great place to stay for a few days. My kids and I felt at home.

The house is very elegant and super clean It’s also the only place of this standard for many miles We noticed that many of the guests like us were doing a cross country trip and this is the place to stay
Whitney was also super accommodating as we arrived earlier then expected and she was very gracious about it

Whitney was super accommodating and helpful We we’re in the process of driving across the country, as it appears are many of the guests, and you will not find a comparable accommodation anywhere near in this area. The house was newly renovated, stylish and very clean. Would absolutely recommend

A very nice small house with a very comfortable bed. I only stayed two nights and it rained the entire time so I can’t speak to the outdoor aspects of her home. I spent my time at the Theodore Roosevelt National Park.
We really enjoyed our stay here. The house and hot tub were perfect. Great host great location!

We had a wonderful stay at this cute little airbnb. It was decorated for Christmas and very festive! The beds were all doubles, as we expected - but it was maybe too small for 6 adults. We were only using it for sleeping as we have family that lives in town. So it worked out. The place was very clean and Whitney is extremely responsive and flexible.
Great Stay
This place is great! Easy location with easy check in. Very cute decor and had all we needed for a family weekend. Would stay there again if we find ourselves back in Dickinson.
Whitney’s place was stylishly decorated, clean, and SO cozy!
Stay was an amazing. Great location. Clean and comfy home with a nice relaxing hot tub.

We had a fantastic stay at Whitney's place and have nothing negative to say. It was very clean (one of the cleanest airbnbs we've ever stayed at,) it was within close proximity to Theodore Roosevelt National Park, and it was very comfortable after a long day of hiking! If you are considering staying at Whitney's home, do it!
This space was so stylish but still comfy. It was perfect for our one night stay as we drove across country. It had everything we needed and had a cute park down the street to walk the dogs.
Great place to stay!
Beautiful home, conveniently located!
Comfortable and cozy home in close proximity to Theodore Roosevelt National Park. Would stay again!
I really enjoyed this stay, the house is very charming, clean, modern. I had a relaxed 2 nights stay during my visit. I strongly recommend it.
Nice house. Clean, bright and well equipped. Plenty of room for the entire family. And close to the interstate making your day trips easier.
This house is gorgeous! Everything is so clean and well designed. Location was perfect for going to Teddy Roosevelt National Park.
Great stay! very clean and neat. Quiet area.

This place is NOT rustic at all! It is beautifully and tastefully decorated and super clean! It's much larger than I expected. The location is perfect. Convenient to Medora and the enchanted highway. Whitney was super responsive and helpful. Would definitely recommend!
Everything was great!
We had a great stay at Whitney's place it was very clean and comfortable. Would happily stay again.
A really great base to rest and then explore the Theodore Roosevelt National Park.

Beautifully update home in the middle of Dickinson. We had a wonderful time visiting family. Utilizing this rental, we had space to go back to for some alone time. Loved watching the lightening and hearing the thunder with the storm that rolled through. I would definitely stay here again if available. Thank you Whitney for being such a gracious host!

Perfect place for visiting TR National Park. The house is about 30 mins from the South Unit and about 1 hr from the North Unit. The property has very easy access, it is clean with plenty of space, and a Walmart less than 10 mins away for groceries. Overall, a great place for families.

BEST AIR BNB EXPERIENCE TO DATE!
I’ve stayed in at least 40 house rentals over the last 10 years and I have to say that Whitney’s Dickinson house is my best experience yet. Maybe it was the cozy bed, or the nice trendy kitchen and home decor, or the sweet back yard patio and hot tub, or the AC pumping in the house on the hot days, or maybe it was Whitneys above and beyond kindness and generosity. Who am I kidding, it was all of it! If you’re thinking about staying here, don’t hesitate, book it now!
Very clean place, nice back-yard, and great location for proximity to National Park and Dinosaur Museum. Highly recommend.
We had a wonderful and relaxing over night stay here. The home was very clean, and had everything we needed! Thanks Whitney!

I booked this home for my parents who gave me feedback for a review.
"Whitney's home was beautifully decorated and exactly what we were looking for! She accommodated our last minute booking and late arrival. We wish we could have stayed longer!"

Great time! Great location, very clean and cute! Perfect location for checking out Medora.
Loved the CLEAN hot tub.
Very nicely decorated home. We were very comfortable here and appreciated having a washer and dryer to use. And the hot tub was dreamy!

Lovely house and great location. Her basement flooded during the crazy Spring snow storms and resulting flooding. The bed rooms are in the basement. She was able to accommodate us despite the issues. We were three adults and all had separate beds. There is a lovely deck with a grill which we used one night and also a hot tub which we did not use. The kitchen is fully stocked with everything you could need if you wish to cook. The repairs to the basement are almost complete so would highly recommend this location!! Great host!!!
Clean, comfortable Airbnb with a hot tub! Was a nice place for my family and pets to stay and the host was easy to communicate with.

Whitney’s place was the perfect resting place after a long day of traveling. Her commitment to comfort and detail was more than apparent throughout our stay. The space is comfortable as well as charming. The perfect home away from home experience.
Very clean and nice inside. The bed was incredibly comfortable
Very nice and comfortable house. Conveniently located to everything we needed. We would stay there again.
Nice, clean place to stay. We stayed for a work meeting and was a great place to gather. Appreciate that this is a true Airbnb - I.e. the owners home that she rents out.
The house is amazing. Whitney is amazing and super helpful!
Please use same note as private
I would highly recommend this place. It's clean close to downtown and the college, and everything that was promised. We had absolutely no complaints. Will definitely stay with Whitney again.
Clean and comfortable home for our trip to Theodore Roosevelt Park. The hot tub was great after a day of hiking.

Whitney's space is a very clean, nice home. It fit our group of five perfectly and we were glad to have use of porch and hot tub. There were nearby parks and restaurants. It was an easy drive to Medora. Whitney was easy to communicate with.

Whitney's place was very clean and cozy, a great place to stay while we were visiting Medora and the Theodore Roosevelt State Park. The bed situation was a different than the listing described - there was only one queen and one full, instead of two queens. I'd definitely stay here again if I had a smaller group!
The home is very pretty and cozy we enjoyed grilling and sitting in hot tub the host is very personal with giving you info to house will definitely recommend this home

Whitney was great to work with. My brother and sister and I had to come into town on very short notice due to a death in the family. She worked out everything with only a days notice.
The home is very comfortable and clean. There is lots of room to hang out. We used the grill on the back deck but rain forced us to dine on the giant dining room table.
One thing to note. The location is advertised as a three bedroom to accommodate 6 people. The upstairs bedroom is beautiful, with a nice queen bed. One room downstairs has a very comfortable full sized bed. The third bedroom has a thin, full sized air mattress. This is my first time using Airbnb. I am fairly laid back, but i thought this was something people deserved to be aware of.
Overall, the experience was great.

Adorable place! Super clean with much attention to detail. Had everything we needed and very comfortable!
The back porch with the grill and hot tub were perfect for relaxing! Very close drive to Medora and Theodore Roosevelt Park.
If You need a place to stay This is it!!

This property is nicely located about 30 minutes from TR park! The host is very helpful and communicative. She is able to answer all your questions and inquiries. She also gives amazing recommendations for the area. I recommend you stay here!
Great place! Great location and very nicely decorated. Has everything you need.
Awesome place to stay. This is our second time here and we will be sure to keep coming back. Accommodations are perfect. Walking distance to local bar/cafe. Locals are a blast. Always feel welcome.
The Dwell was a very pleasant surprise. Great accommodations, great host, and within walking distance to the local watering hole. My group and I plan on making this an annual stay for hunting season.

It says on the listing that Michelle is a Superhost, and in our experience that description is very accurate. She was very accommodating and easy to communicate with. The place was clean, inviting, restful and relaxing. The beds were super comfortable! We enjoyed being able to cook a simple supper there. This was our first time to book a stay through Airbnb and Michelle made it a very positive experience!
I was impressed with our stay. Michelle was a fabulous host! The unit was well renovated, peaceful and relaxing. Would definitely stay again!
We loved staying here.
Great place, great host.

Michelle was very helpful and responsive. We did a family trip to Theodore Roosevelt National Park and this was a great place to stay along the route for us. The place was very clean and had everything we needed.

A lovely place to stay if you are visiting Roosevelt National Park or heading on to Wisconsin…clean, cute space, extremely comfortable beds, sitting benches/ chairs outside…would recommend Michelle’s place to anyone! She too is very responsive and accommodating for late check in. 🌞🌻🌳

Michelle was a welcoming and accommodating host. The rooms’ decor was inviting and felt like home. From fresh cut flowers to treats and drinks, Michelle went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable.
Michelle is an excellent hostess and we had a great time. Everything was clean and communication was simple and easy I highly recommend.
Would book again!!!
Had the best time staying here! An amazing view! 🥰
Perfect stay for a quick night traveling to my next destination. Would definitely recommend.
Great stay!
All went well with our stay. Mott is a very quiet town. The river is quite peaceful
Great out of the way retreat.
A neat little cottage and a friendly host!
Great place to stay. House was great. Mott was great.
We enjoyed our time at the Cannonball Cottage and will book again when in Mott.
We were looking for a quiet peaceful place to read and relax. The cottage was super cute and clean. The view was was very beautiful and calming.

For a weekend get away from it all, Cannonball Cottage is the place. Secluded and peaceful, the cottage is this and more. Plenty of hot water and great water pressure. Well stocked kitchen and love love the gas stove.

Lauren's house was charming and the decor was very unique and like the photos. We enjoyed the peaceful location with beautiful sunsets from the porch. Plenty of bird watching also. Lauren was helpful and flexible as a host.
A great little place! We stayed for one night. It is just as listed!
Great little cottage to be able to relax and enjoy my trip. Wonderful place and great people, excellent response prior to my visit.

This is a very unique location. Vast prairie landscape, wide open spaces and quite pastoral indeed. The river running alongside the cottage was a nice touch. As was the charming small town. Not a place we would normally get the opportunity to experience.
The cottage was everything we needed. The highlight is the porch for enjoying coffee and/or cocktails looking out at the landscape.
Very fun and colorful house with a fun theme for an old house. Cozy with good shower and hot water. Lots of kitchen supplies.
Beautiful, peaceful Airbnb! Loved all the character on the inside and outside, and watching the sunset on the porch. Grateful to have found this unique spot for a night!
Always a great place to stay. Beautiful area and a great house. Hope to be back!
We loved Cannonball Cottage! It is PERFECT!
Beautiful view from this lovely cottage in Mott!
Third time here, so charming and peaceful can’t wait to come back!

Cute little farmhouse very close to Mott. The firepit was ready and sitting out on the back deck was so relaxing. The river is down a very steep bank so accessing it was not possible. We were able to find some fishing spots close by so it worked out fine. There are a few neighbors but everyone was super friendly and we stayed over the 4th of July and got a great fireworks show.
Lauren was very accommodating. thanks for a wonderful stay.

This was our second visit, the first was two summers ago. The central a/c is tremendous upgrade over the portable in-window unit. This was a 3 senior guys mini vacation to see Teddy Roosvelt Nation park. Lauren has lots of local information available. We would highly recommend the "Cannonball Cottage" for a group of 3-4. The local grocery had good stocking and the Pheasant Caafe has tasty food. We cooked several meals, and the kitchen pantry is well stocked.

We stayed at the Cannonball Cottage while attending a seminar about a mile away. Since it was just my husband, myself, and our dogs, it worked out well. The only true bedroom had a double/full sized bed and a single bed. The second room with another single also had the shower and you had to walk through this room to get to the toilet and sink.
I thought if you are staying with your children or close family, this would work out okay. If you are staying with friends, make sure everyone understands the sleeping logistics to alleviate any uncomfortableness that might arise.
The only other thing to note was the very steep drop off to the river. I am not sure the pictures accurately depict this hill. If you have small children or dogs, this may be an issue.
Pros: Easy to find; all the comforts of home; comfortable sitting room; modern stove and fridge; fantastic, responsive host.
Cons: Steep drop off to river; bedroom/shower placement.
In short, a great place and would stay again!

This riverside cottage is very cute and comfortable. It's an old house that has been updated by someone very artistic. Bright colors, cute art, and everything we needed for a couple of peaceful days. No TV was not an issue for us at all. I would recommend driving to Lemmon for dinner at R Bar. The local cafe was disappointing, to say the very least. The cottage is located out of town, with the Cannonball River meandering within a stones throw. Comfortable beds, plenty of linens, spices for cooking & a Keurig. This place is perfect for those who avoid the dreary, antiseptic feeling of hotel rooms.

Lauren's home was perfect. It is surrounded by beautiful scenery. The home was very clean and comfortable. Such a great and quiet location and I slept great! Wonderful communication and fast responses from Lauren. I loved the place!

Beautiful, peaceful, cozy and perfect. Quick stop on our long drive from San Diego, California to Ontario, Canada, it was exactly what we needed. The cottage is comfortable, warm and inviting, secluded and quaint. All you need for a little getaway. Watching the sun set from the back porch was the icing on the cake! Beds were so comfortable, with soft linens and plenty of blankets.
Well equipped kitchen and bath with all of the necessities, including plenty of towels! The art work adds a nice touch, especially the painting of the women on the back porch of this very cottage!
Would highly recommend Lauren’s cannonball cottage and would love to come back and stay longer!

Quiet location. It was very muddy outside ( I know the host had no control over it) just to give you a heads up. The house is small and cozy it was nice and warm inside with the cold weather and snow outside. One other thing to note is there is no tv but really good WiFi.
This worked out great and met our needs for a 1 night stay.
Great place in Mott.

We truly enjoyed our stay at the Cannonball Inn. The accommodations were spot on and the sunset views were stunning. We took advantage of the perfectly positioned fire pit each night and enjoyed relaxing on the covered porch.
Beautiful sunsets! Great location for hunting.
Comfortable bed and hot water.
Great host, very responsive and well stocked accommodations. Peaceful and enjoyable setting. Our purpose for our stay was hunting and absolutely enjoyed the accommodations!
Very cute cottage!
Lauren is a great host and the cannonball cottage is amazing. I loved the wrap around porch.
Great for a couples weekend away!
REALLY CUTE HOUSE AND GREAT VIEW!!
We loved staying in this cottage. The view of the night sky from the porch was amazing!
Wondering location and fun decor. You must try the Carmel rolls at the Pheasant Cafe. It was a peaceful and relaxing weekend at the little gem in Mott ND
Lovely place with a lovely view for a weekend getaway with friends!
Great stay! We’ve stayed here twice and love the unique cottage feel. Most peaceful place ever, charming decor, comfortable amenities, and very clean and well kept.
Cannonball cottage was a great stay! Right on Cannonball river, just a couple minutes from the main street in town. Made for sunset watching on the porch and star gazing, cute and just as listed.
Great place to stay in Mott!
Great sunsets over the river. Beautiful. Peaceful. Quiet.

Cannonball Cottage was everything we expected and exactly what we look for in an Airbnb stay. The decor was wonderful - so much fun with the colors and personal artwork. The river was fabulously scenic and we did not want to leave. (Bring bug spray if in the summer time though.) Lauren was very responsive and helpful and it was great our dogs could be there to enjoy it too. If only we could have stayed longer. If you are anywhere near Mott in your travels, STAY HERE!
Such a great find! Adorable, quiet, beautiful. The cabin is so cute and comfortable. The wrap around deck overlooking the river is gorgeous. So fun for us and our pup!
One bedroom with 2 comfortable beds. Another bed in a nook around the corner. Very comfortable and sure appreciated the air conditioning!
Nice stay! Very charming cottage...not a lot of privacy between bedrooms and the bathroom.
We absolutely loved our stay at the cottage! Everything was clean and exactly as described. We were even able to sit and watch a thunderstorm on the porch, which was amazing. Highly recommend!
Super cute. We will be back!!
We stayed here for our trip to Theodore Roosevelt National Park.

Great little cozy cottage! A special place to relax and unwind! We loved the front porch to sit relax and enjoy the birds and the river and sunsets. Everything you need is right there, this was our first Airbnb experience, we won’t hesitate to do it again! Thank you Lauren!
Second stay at the cottage--even lovelier in the early Summer. Such a tranquil, restorative place. Perfect home base for Theodore Roosevelt National Park.

If you're in Mott this is the place to stay!!
Joyce K
Very flexible and accommodating. Loved the little quaint cottage and gorgeous views. Watch out for the Mama birds! :)
Cute little cabin. Awesome view!
Great place to stay, everything we needed to enjoy our stay even though we arrived in a spring blizzard 😂

This was our second stay here and we will be back. Love the kitchy charm! The cottage has a well supplied kitchen, new mechanicals, comfortable beds, and a porch view to die for. No TV but good WiFi so if you need to catch a show bring a device. But the stars at night and the howls of coyotes in the distance is all the show we needed.
This little cottage is a gem. It was a perfect little place to have a cozy getaway weekend. Definitely recommend!

We enjoyed staying at Lauren house. It was very quiet out and peaceful. The stars were magnificent at night. I was able to see the Milky Way Saturn shooting stars and hear the coyotes. There was also a great horned owl that was talking to us. The house was extremely clean and toasty warm in the winter. Funny of towels and wash cloths and linens. And there were basics for cooking.
Nice cozy little cottage with lots of amenities. A great stop for our little family and our dogs.

Beautiful unique little cabin overlooking a winding river. We saw 12 deer eating the field across from the cabin. Sunsets we wonderful. We felt like our dogs were welcomed and they provided blankets for us to protect the furniture. Very clean.

Lauren’s place was great. It was exactly what we needed for the night. Small, warm (stayed in December), cozy, and private. Definitely off the beaten trail which we loved. If I’m ever in the area again I plan on staying here.
Very nice and clean. Will definitely consider staying again.
Nice little cottage that is exactly as described. Very quiet, no traffic, warm and cozy. Clean and enjoyable with a nice little kitchen with basic amenities.
great place to stay on Mott!!
Quaint and cozy little cottage with great views and close to town! Centrally located for all of our adventures!
Simply, Lauren’s cottage is warm, welcoming and a great place relax after a long day.
We weren’t able to stay and had to cancel at the last minute. Lauren was gracious and understanding! We hope to reschedule and visit soon!
A fun little place in an amazing location ~ very beautiful natural setting! The birdwatching while I was there in autumn was great- nice place to get creative work done

The perfect little whimsical cottage with a wrap-around porch overlooking a stream. This is the place for restoration. Pictures can't convey the loving and quaint details that add up to a warm embrace in the cottage.
Beautiful home with a lot of fun character and unique additions, while keeping the old charm. Great location, easy to find. We enjoyed the dining options just a few minutes away.
Just what we needed!

An absolutely adorable cottage in an amazing location. Beautiful sunsets off the back porch. WiFi was good, also me and my wife both had full bars on our phones with AT&T. The river was a little below the porch so had to climb down to it, but the fishing was really good off the shore below. The area was really nice and peaceful and the town had a very good grocery store where we did all of our shopping during our stay.

We had a great stay at the cabin for some sharp-tail grouse hunting in the area. Especially nice that dogs are allowed. The house is clean and has a great view to the west over looking the Cannonball river which we had some scenic sunsets. The internet connection was also welcomed to keep in touch.
Cannonball Cottage was exactly what we needed—a quiet, clean place to sleep halfway along our road trip to Montana.
We really enjoyed our stay here. The cottage is charming, so thoughtfully appointed. And the location was beautiful and peaceful- can’t beat sitting on the deck over the river, watching the sun set.

The Cannonball Cottage is a lovely, well stocked Airbnb. Everything clean, neat and tidy. Check in/Check out process easy. The view of the river from the wrap around deck is amazing. Bugs were a little intense. While pretty remote it served as a nice base for Theodore Roosevelt National Park.
This was the perfect spot for a restful night after a long day’s travel. Peaceful and clean with comfy beds.

This is place is unbelievably cute. I really enjoyed the creativity, cleanliness, and attention to detail that surrounded me. It was fun making myself home at Lauren’s! It was so comfortable to catch up on rest after a long day of driving. Would definitely recommend!
Make a special trip to stay here. This home is wonderful.

This cottage was already so cute but it really exceeded expectations. Flow of the place is so nice, incredible views right on the river, minutes out of town for last min groceries, and super well appointed, all the pots/pans/utensils you'd want. We stayed for a week, cooked every meal and weren't wanting of anything. Oh and the wifi was superb! Such a great stay, thank you!
Beautiful setting with a great porch. A good stop on our XC trip.
Very cute cottage right on the Cannonball River. Lauren is great at answering all your questions quickly.

This cottage is a real gem! The location by the river is wonderful. It was so peaceful to sit on the porch in the mornings and evenings! The home itself is thoughtfully decorated and genuinely adorable. Our family stayed here on a trip out to Theodore Roosevelt National Park and, while it's still a bit of a drive to get to the park, we were glad to have this little place to enjoy stargazing and family time. It made our trip especially memorable.

Adorable getaway im ND. Definitely a highlight of our travels through the badlands. The sunset from the porch was incredible, and the river out back is lovely. All the amenities worked perfectly and made the cottage feel like home.

Don't be put off by the small size, the space is well used and our family didn't feel cramped at all. The river is peaceful in the morning and the stars are amazing at night. Just make sure to read the descriptions and see the photos so you know what you're getting here.
This was a welcome and peaceful stop for us in our cross-country drive. We enjoyed eating on the deck overlooking the river, and the sunset was lovely.
Great stay. Quiet location. Beautiful sunsets.

Such a beautiful location! The deck and backyard area look right out onto the Cannonball River. We saw 2 beautiful sunsets and we’re even visited by some deer! Air conditioning worked like a charm in the HOT HOT weather. Us and our pup were 100% comfortable and happy here during our stay ☺️
The Cannonball Cottage was a great place to relax and unwind during our cross country drive. The scenery was beautiful and the cottage was very comfortable. The sunset was amazing!
Very nice and pretty.
The house was cozy, comfortable, and in a pretty place. It’s definitely isolated. Hosts are readily available if you need them.

The little green prairie house is sweet, clean and decorated for the period. The beautiful Cannonball River is right out the front and is so relaxing and picturesque. Restorative is the word that comes to mind. Thank you Lauren!

Of all the Airbnbs I've stayed in, this one has to be the cutest!! My friends and I loved the decor of this place, which added to the peaceful and rustic feel of the property. We were able to watch a beautiful sunset from the porch and take in the scenery. Lauren was very helpful and a fantastic host. I definitely recommend this place and hope to be back soon!

If you need some repose this is for you. All you can hear are the birds chirping in this idyllic location. The cottage had everything we needed. Walkable to Mott’s main street. Fun to walk the Cannonball trail and explore this beautiful area of ND.

My stay at Cannonball Cottage was exactly as I hoped for. Great place for downtime and decompression. Quiet and comfortable with all the necessities. Having no TV was spectacular but WiFi was always there if I needed it. The river is perfectly serene and feet from the back porch, a terrific foreground for some amazing sunsets. Pheasants and deer nightly visitors just other side of the river. Nice breeze always blowing, only turned the a/c on one time. Beds were comfortable and linens/towels plentiful. Fridge get's full so bring a cooler if you have lots of cold drinks. Will definitely stay again if ever near Mott.

This is a charming cottage with a view overlooking the Cannonball River and the rolling fields of southern North Dakota. The cottage is well maintained and well equipped. We stayed here to visit Theodore Roosevelt National Park, which is about 90 miles away. However, it was an easy drive to the park, and a delight to come back to the serenity of the cottage.
Very remote, and beautiful view from the back of the house.

We needed a last-minute place to stay while traveling cross-country, and Lauren was quick and responsive with our request and very helpful in her message.
The old farm house was SO charming! The colorful decor is adorable and inviting, the vintage furniture is well cared for and surprisingly comfortable.
The view off the back porch is stunning- my only complaint is the mosquitoes outside, but what can you expect near a river in the summer?

Great farm feeling right on the river. we loved sitting in the porch in the evening and watching the sun set and the weather you could see from miles away. The house gave you the nostalgic feeling of living in the old days... be prepared for just the basics. the the was decorated very nice. we loved our stay!
We really liked the location of the property. So quiet. Just the thing after spending time in Teddy Roosevelt Park.
The house is cute and we enjoyed our stay. The only downside is that there were so many mosquitoes outside that we couldn't enjoy sitting out looking at the river. The views were beautiful.

This is a very charming cottage in rural North Dakota. We stayed here with our two dogs and enjoyed the beautiful scenery and unique touches in the cottage!
We did have some concerns about the cleanliness of the home however, which we brought up with Lauren and she addressed it appropriately. Otherwise, we enjoyed our stay! 😊

Cannonball Cottage is a delight! All the comforts of home -- and a stunning view! Clean and easy to get to and the back porch on the river was so so peaceful! Thank you for offering such a wonderful place!

We stayed for the second time this June, and once again, it was a very peaceful, relaxing, comfortable, and quiet night. The sunsets over the river and the farm fields are just glorious. This time, we enjoyed seeing a nest full of baby Robins on the back porch fledge and take their first flight. It was a wonderful place to rest in the midst of a long cross-country road trip. We would definitely come back again.
I stayed at Cannonball on my way to Idaho with my dogs and they LOVED it out there. Was perfect weather to crack the window for an evening breeze. Very peaceful.
Beautiful cottage right next to the Cannonball river and is great for wildlife watching. We had a peaceful stay and will return when we are visiting the area again!

We loved this cozy cottage and would highly recommend it to family and friends. The beds were very comfortable and the kitchen was well-outfitted. Best of all was the porch view of the sunset over Cannonball River. We wanted to book this place for the return trip but unsurprisingly it had been snatched up for those dates. We enjoyed our stay very much!
A great place for a quiet retreat. Colorful and cozy.

Loved this cottage so much!! It was a perfect stay for our family. It’s just a really fun and tranquil and beautiful place to be off the beaten trail. Love the creativity and style. Love the river. Love the sunset. Hope to come back!

Lauren's Cottage on the Cannonball has been on my saved list for a few years. It worked well in a quick trip from Fargo to drive Teddy Roosevelt National Park. We are two grumpy old guys that travel with two adorable Shetland sheepdogs, Logan, 14 and Cullen 3. The bright colors and multiple pattern materials did not offend our masculine sensibilities. I was pleasantly surprised that the cottage was larger than I expected, especially the two separate sleeping areas. We experienced a beautiful sunset and photos of it and the cottage that I featured on Facebook that got a ton of likes and positive comments. I see lots of reviews of Airbnb places that say, We can't wait to come back" and wonder how many ever do. We have never stayed in the same place twice in 42 years of traveling together. But I think Cannonball Cottage just might change that. I would not hesitate to recommend the cottage to couples or small families. Lauren has provided tons of local information, great reading material and a few family friendly games. Lauren is point on about directions, Apple Maps, Google, Waze, and my Garmin GPS all sent us south on the road not north. Thanks Lauren for making it possible for us to get a small taste of CANNONBALL COTTAGE.

Such a fun and quirky place in a beautiful, peaceful spot! We loved our stay, and felt like we had stepped into 1955 the moment we entered the house. Absolutely stunning backdrop agains the river and rolling farm fields. We loved watching the sunset and listening to the red winged black birds talking to one another. Had a fun game of scrabble in the little parlor while watching the sun set over the fields. Great out-of-the-way spot for some relaxation and vintage fun!
Exceptional A+ accommodation Highly Recommend Cannonball Cottage !
Our stay at Cannonball Cottage was the perfect weekend getaway. The interior was quaint and full of charm, and the views from the wrap around porch were stunning!
Very cute cottage! Lots of style. I got lucky with the weather and was able to watch a gorgeous sunset from the deck. You will love Lauren's darling cottage.
This was a quirky and fun space off the beaten path. It was hard to fully evaluate our stay because we were there such a short time, but I would say the beds were comfy and it was clean and fresh!
Great spot!
This cottage is such a cozy little oasis! I loved all the supplies Lauren had around for her guests. We loved the serenity for our overnight stay. Our pups appreciated the pet friendliness as well!

We hope to be back to this enchanting cottage just off the enchanted highway (a sculpture filled stretch of road). The house is filled with eclectic thoughtful touches. Even the just right glass to drink ice tea on the beautiful porch. Lauren was an excellent host. Thanks 🧜🏼‍♀️💗

Stayed here for a night with my husband and our pets during our cross country move and we’re so happy with the tranquility of the cottage and the river :) cozy little spot, close to a little grocery store we just cooked up some dinner and watched the sun go down on the river! If I ever find myself in North Dakota I would definitely stay again! :)

The cabin is quaint and in a quiet location. It was clean and the host was responsive. We had a bit of trouble finding it but that was due to my gps getting confused. We stayed on a cross country road trip and it was a welcomed quiet spot to stop after driving all day.

The most beautifully peaceful place to clear your mind or enjoy the wonders of slowing down for some time. The deck is perfect for watching the sun set with a glass of wine or watching the birds land in the river in the morning. The air is fresh and the house is everything you will need for a comfortable stay. I would definitely stay here again. Lauren is very available or anything you might need and has done a great job with ensuring your stay is everything you thought it would be.

We really enjoyed our weekend at the Cannonball Cottage. It was super cute and clean and the back porch was wonderful to hang out on and soak up the early spring warmth and beautiful sunsets. It was the perfect quiet weekend getaway for me, my husband, and our pup.

Cannonball Cottage was a nice stopover on our roadtrip. The house was clean and had everything you could need. The neighborhood was very peaceful and quiet. We saw loads of stars and I bet the creek is wonderful in the summer!
Small space with a lot of character and charm. Nice location on the edge of town. The beds were comfortable and the space was clean. We had everything we needed to have an enjoyable time. :)
Charming little house on the river. We stayed in the winter and the house was nice and warm. This would be a nice chill place for summer sunsets on the river with a campfire to boot.
Nice place and great view!
The cottage was very clean, beds comfortable and lots of good pillows. My wife and I spent Thanksgiving week here and really enjoyed our stay.
Very nice place. Quite area and clean and friendly place. Would stay again if in area again. Thank you again for sharing your house.
The cottage has lots of little touches here and there. It shows the host has put a lot of thoughts into it. It is also close to the enchanted highway which is a must-see if you are in the area.
Great cottage on the Cannonball River! A contemporary space that is artistically decorated. Nice deck overlooking the river. Very clean and communication was great. Will stay again!

Lauren’s place is one of a kind. Clean and cozy with a great location. This is our second time staying at the “Cannonball Cottage” and we plan on coming back. Lauren is a great host. She is timely, thorough, and easily available if need be. Thanks for the great stay again!
Lauren’s place is convenient to town and has a wonderful view of the river. I enjoyed that it was pet friendly.

Everything we were looking for in a place to stay, and so much more. Very comfy, and the view is stunning! By the way, go outside at night with a clear sky - and the stars will literally take your breath away!
This is the perfect place for an unplugged getaway. Sitting by the fire pit was an ideal way to end the day - very peaceful. Everything has a 50s vibe which we really liked. 10/10!
Great place to stay! Our pups loved the open areas around the house and it was a really neat space

You Can expect a wonderful charming wonderland when you walk inside… And the gorgeous views from the patio are outstanding! If you are looking for quiet, comfortable, gorgeous views, as you read your book, play cards with your spouse or your children, or just walk around it’s a great little town with many Experiences all around you. PS loved watching the geese fly in to the field across the river. This is definitely the place to be for peace, Quiet, and relaxing.
the porch faces west for a spectacular view of the setting sun. the vintage decor is fun.
Peaceful and quiet. Lots of stars in the North Dakota sky.
Great!
We enjoyed our stay at the cottage, the unique decor, and beautiful surroundings.
One of the coolest and most unique AirBNB stays I’ve ever had. Highly recommended!!

We stumbled upon the town of Mott as a convenient place to stay on our road trip, and ended up loving this charming cottage! It’s lovingly restored with thoughtful decor and the sunset was beautiful from the back porch. Would definitely stay here again when passing through North Dakota.
Cottage is as described and a great place to rest and relax. It is well furnished/stocked with almost anything a person needs besides food. Would return to this place.
We stayed at Lauren’s for a night on our cross country road trip. Very clean and the kitchen was stocked with kitchen supplies. Dogs allowed!

I loved staying at Lauren’s place. It was a neat house in a beautiful setting on the water, with everything we needed. Lauren was a great host, and check-in was easy. I would definitely stay here again!

Quiet, comfortable clean cottage with a great back porch overlooking water and the vast horizon beyond! Great place to unwind and get away from it all. Lauren was extremely hospitable and took great care of us!

Lauren was super responsive via the app. Her cottage is adorable and the river provided a great little oasis for the weekend. Mott is a pretty remote town, but that’s just what we wanted. Would recommend for a weekend getaway!

My mom and I stayed for a night as a resting place on a road trip west. Was a great place to rest our heads, sunset views and river were gorgeous. Very remote, but assuming anyone who knows the area knows that.
Cute little house, beautiful deck view, Quiet country location , very peaceful setting

Lauren’s place is cute and quirky. She is a wonderful and responsive host. The pictures are accurate. There was enough space for my family of four to sleep and sit down for meals. There is one bed in the shower area, but that wasn’t a huge deal. We just made sure everyone showered before my daughter went to bed for the evening. The place was very close to the Enchanted Highway, which my daughters enjoyed so much we drove it twice. We were also able to drive over and explore Theodore Roosevelt National Park. The view from the porch is just beautiful. I could’ve sat out there for hours in the morning and at sunset looking at the scenery. We didn’t explore too much in Mott or Regent because this was just a quick stopover.

This is a very cool place to stay. The house decor is bold and fun, and the inside is comfortable and clean. It was the perfect low-tech spot for a quick overnight stay for us on our way up to Canada. We didn’t get a chance to enjoy the fire pit because we got in so late, but we did like the view in the morning of the river from the wraparound deck. There were two twin beds and one queen bed.
Lovely little place, be aware the shower is in a bedroom, but the views are unbeatable. Great space to chill and call home base.
This little cottage was so cute! We loved the home-y uniqueness that it had. The outside space was great. We really enjoyed our stay and would love to return in the future.

The cottage is adorable and we were endlessly entertained by the quirky spaces in the house. The house was clean, cozy, and well appointed. One small thing for those traveling with little kids, and this is not in any way a knock on the house, but I didn’t notice how steep the dropoff is to the creek from the pictures. It’s gorgeous and wonderful for the sunset, but I had to keep an extra close eye on my kids to make sure we didn’t leave there as a family of 3 instead of 4. Great communication and easy check in and check out!
Definitely an eclectic place. Appreciated the timely communications from host. A nice spot close to the Enchanted Highway in North Dakota.
Wonderful river bank location with great views. A great stay with easy check in and communication
a lovely place to stop! thank you!

What a fantastic place! We were passing through and I wish that we could have spent several days. It was glorious to wake up and enjoy a cup of coffee on the porch and watch the red-wing black birds and a robin attending to its nest. We had the most spectacular thunder storm that was amazing to watch. The place was comfortable and had everything we needed. It is very cutely decorated. We would definitely stay here again! Thank you!!!!
Lovely little place and wonderful host!
Fantastic experience if you’re looking to get away for a bit! Cute place with lots of character and charm. Very attentive hostess. Couldn’t have asked for a better experience!
Absolutely beautiful! The cottage has character and an awesome view of mother nature at its best! Deer, fish, muskrats, birds etc. Bonfire to enjoy and a covered deck to stay out of any weather.

We just had an amazing weekend at Cannonball Cottage. The cottage is adorable- decorated in lots of fun colors with so many unique touches. There were plenty of pots and pans and such to cook something easily. The beds were comfortable and cozy. The view from the back porch can’t be beat. Thank you for a wonderful weekend
It was a great, small place with a great view of the Cannonball River from the porch
Absolutely loved Lauren's place. The house was wonderful with amazing touches which makes you feel the ease and peace of a simpler time. I love the view of the river and would recommend her place.
Be prepared to step back in time!Very unique cottage with beautiful sunsets. It has everything you need to be comfortable. Lauren was very responsive and gave clear instructions.
Quick responses, easy check in, clean place and beautiful scenery

Lauren’s cottage is a perfect sanctuary for two. We stayed during the days of COVID-19 as part of a birthday trip for my partner. The full kitchen allowed us to cook without worrying about finding takeout every (actually any) night. If you grew up on the Midwest or Great Plains something in there will remind you of your childhood or something passed down in your family.
Mott seemed like a cute little town that circumstances prevented us from really exploring. We did check out Theodore Roosevelt National Park for hiking, the Enchanted Highway for a lovely drive, and Salem Sue for the perfect amount of kitsch.
Our trip back included talking about when we might stay there again and where we might find sum in at places to stay on trips to other regions. I’d recommend that anyone stay at the Cannonball Cottage.

This is going to be a long read! For anyone looking for a truly unique stay or even just a convenient one, I promise it is worth the read. Someone had posted a negative review that almost made me walk away from this listing. And that would have been our loss! This place is amazing!!! A cute cottage on the end of town, with a wrap around porch on 3 sides, and very close to the water. To say that this cottage and her host are accommodating does NOT do justice to every little thing that has been done to insure a fantastic experience. The beds, linens, and pillows, so cozy, so fresh, and crazy comfortable... Pssst...there are duvets and down pillows, and down alternative pillows. The kitchen is a delight! To hang out in and cook. Lauren has thought out every detail and gone so far above and beyond! The living room is colorful, comfortable, and cozy. Quaint, Cozy, Unique, Colorful (in a good way), and the views from the porch? I don't have a word for it as it is beyond beautiful... This place is like one big hug, sparkling clean, everything you need and more, and it is fun and relaxing. Absolutely worth every penny!!! There is a catfish of rather mythical proportions that showed itself twice. And how awesome is it that someone can shower while leaving the toilet and sink free in another room? This is glamping. If your grandmother was Martha Stewart before being Martha was cool, and had a cabin/ cottage, it would be the Cannonball Cottage. Lauren is an AWESOME host with great communication! This cottage is EVERYTHING Airbnb was designed and intended to be, on steroids.
The Cannonball Cottage is amazing. We really loved our stay there for 5 days! We will definitely be back. It had everything we could possibly want, and so peaceful.
Loved our stay at the Cannonball Cottage. It was the perfect stop for our cross country road trip. Kitchen was perfect and the wrap around porch was a nice break from driving. Thanks!
This place is just lovely. It’s peaceful and relaxing and very comfortable. It’s the perfect place to go when all you want to do is relax. If I’m ever back that way, I’m booking it again!
Such a relaxing and peaceful escape from the chaos! We loved the fire pit and the deck overlooking the river. Wish we could have stayed longer. Thanks for sharing your little slice of paradise!
What a great place! So clean and a blast from the past! Wonderful view of the Cannonball river and an awesome porch we sat on and enjoyed a cup of coffee! Highly recommend!
Cozy place with a neat collection of modern furniture and one-of-a-kind art. Very clean. Happy we stayed here.

No privacy, sheers only on window both outside and inside home, including bedroom and bathroom. One bed is in the shower area which is really in a common area between the kitchen and the bedroom. Home is very dated, and lacking many comforts of home. Home is in a very agricultural/industrial area.
Rustic is ok this was run down, NO PRIVACY and poorly appointed. Very small, bathroom was just strange. The toilet and sink were together in a small space which only had very sheer and completely see-through window treatment and an interior window which had a twin bed directly outside it. That twin bed was in a common area which is where the shower was located, again no privacy!

This was a very unique place, you feel lime you have been transported back to 1920’s - but with some modern amenities! The view is fantastic. No WiFi - perfect to unplug. The decorations were thoughtful, and the house has been restored with great care. It was very different but very pleasant.
Lauren was easy to get a hold of, check-in was a breeze. The house is very clean.
What a special place! Definitely pleasantly surprised.

Exactly as described. The cottage is a whimsical, mermaid paradise in North Dakota! We experienced all the hygge. So cozy! We would love to come back! If you plan on having coffee, bring your own cream and sugar. Also, Mott is a very small, rural town and there really isn’t anywhere to get groceries so plan ahead. There’s a gas station, but that was the only place open.
The Cannonball Cottage is a perfect place to stay when hunting around Mott. It's close to town but in a quiet area with a good view. The house was nicely equipped and Lauren was an excellent host.
Perfect space for two guest.

We had a great stay at Cannonball Cottage. My husband and I were pheasant hunting PLOTS and public land near Mott so location was great. A bright, cozy stay in the middle of sub-zero temperatures :-).
Simple, clean and worked perfect for our stay.
Awesome views, great place to stay for a long weekend.

We LOVED this sweet cottage. It’s right on the Cannonball River with lovely views stretching forever of river and rural farmland. No traffic on the road and unbelievably quiet. Lauren also kindly helped us connect with a very knowledgeable local resource for my husband’s photography quests. Very special visit, we will return.
This is a beautifully situated cabin. There are incredible views of Cannonball river. If you're in the area, it's definitely a unique place.

One word, Home. The cottage is beautiful and clean. The vintage touches made it feel cozy and inviting. It was peaceful to get away from the noises of the city and indulge in a good book. We wished we spent a few more nights here!
Interesting place off the beaten path to stay

I really loved this little cabin. We got there late so it was dark and quite the wind storm was blowing through but after the wind died down and we were able to sit on the porch, it was very relaxing after a long day on road. We could see lightning on the horizon and stars overhead. The next morning we sat out with coffee and watched the river flow by and enjoyed the peace and quiet before we had to head back on the road. The views were lovely. I loved the way the cabin was decorated and it was very clean with all the amenities although a coffee pot is all I need! I would love to stay here again if I ever come through this area again.
Lauren was easy going and helpful. Rustic cottage that met my needs.
Lauren's place is quiet and has a beautiful view of the sunset! We loved relaxing on the porch and playing a game of Scrabble (game courtesy of Lauren).
Super cute, super fun! Perfect pit stop for our cross country trip.
Just like the pictures and the other reviews. Off the beaten path, but we all need that now and then.

For a peaceful setting with an incredible view of prairie farm land, this is the spot in SW North Dakota. The accommodations were very nice and absolutely everything we needed for our stay was on site. This is a very unique cottage that is perfect for a romantic getaway or just a relaxing visit.

The house was so charming! The decor, color scheme, and furniture details were so cute! Pictures didn't do it justice. I can tell someone put a lot of thought and care into rehabbing the house. It had everything we needed and more. We enjoyed an amazing sunset on the back porch and were able to get out with our telescope. The sky was so full of stars! It's right by the river, so bring bug spray. We had no reception while we were there or for most of our very scenic drive in. Not a big deal for us, but something to be aware of. Overall, a really great spot. We loved our stay in the cottage!

Very, very cute place. It’s super cozy and has a fantastic view of the sunset. There’s no WiFi, which was a little inconvenient at first, but ultimately made the stay even better. It can get a little hot, though, and there is a steep staircase that goes straight to a locked door that is nothing more than off-putting. The shower is in the same room as one bed, with the rest of the bathroom in that room. The nearest town goes to bed very, very early, but ultimately if you’re looking for an escape, this is the right place.
Good location…close to Theodore Roosevelt Nat’l Park. Kyle was nice and welcoming. I loved the sound of the birds chipping.
Clean! At a campground.

The place was clean and comfortable enough. Could use some kitchen towels in addition to one roll of paper towels. Wi Fi didn’t work. Password made connection but would not work on 2 different devices. My main issue is that I did not hear back from Kyle for 2 hours after calling to check in. Fortunately, the back door was inadvertently left unlocked so we let ourselves in after no response for about 30 minutes. Kyle explained that he was “ distracted” because he was managing catering for 1000. Might I suggest having someone else answer your campsite calls if you are doing something else that’s more important.
For the area it's great. The beds could be more comfortable but it was great other than that.
Nice place
Great value, place was as advertised. All the comforts of home.
Good place, close to TRNP. The room was big and convenient. Bathroom (toilet) could be cleaner but was OK. We liked it.
Urja’s place was great. It was clean, easy to find, and comfortable. And Urja is a great host. Who always provided the information I needed usually even before I knew to ask. I recommend this Airbnb.

She is one of the best Airbnb host I have ever met.
Would love to visit again!
Highly recommend!

Urja was so great to us! We enjoyed her little dog, Bella, who was a blast to play with! One day I had some car troubles and Urja volunteered to give me a ride to my vehicle to pick it up after it got fixed! We would enjoy staying with her again, definitely!

Urja is such a lovely host (and her dog, Bella, is a fantastic co-host!) and her home is absolutely lovely. There are many thoughtful details throughout, and Urja did her utmost to make me feel welcome and at home.
The location is very convenient for access to Theodore Roosevelt National park (only a 30-minute drive to the South Unit entrance).
I highly recommend staying in this lovely home!
Urja’s place was exactly what we needed! It was peaceful and clean! Urja was a kind and gracious host. We enjoyed our stay here. And her linens were SO SOFT!

We had a lovely stay with Urja! It was a pleasure to cook in her clean, well-equipped kitchen, and she was attentive to our every need! The bed was very comfortable, and the room was spacious and relaxing.

Urja’s hospitality and friendly atmosphere made this stay relaxing. She is attentive and responsive when needed. Plus add in her pups 🐶 they were nice too! The place was clean, peaceful and quiet, exactly what I needed after a very long drive. I would definitely stay here again..
Thank you!!

Urja was communicative before arrival, responsive on the day of my pending arrival, and friendly upon my arrival. Her townhome is clean, comfortable. We chatted a bit that evening and a little the next morning before I departed, taking her suggestion for a good diner for breakfast. Thanks, Urja! Hoping you return to CS one day! ; )
Urja was so sweet and her dogs were adorable! Great place to stay before heading to Theodore Roosevelt NP! Highly recommend!
Thanks for the quick stop on the way to Yellowstone!
Everything was perfect! Excellent communication, great space, awesome location.
Close to everything, and was a wonderful place to stay at!
Very clean and Urja was very kind and welcoming.
Very cozy. Urja was super nice and accommodating. Bella is super cute

A very clean and comfortable room and bathroom, and Urja is a very pleasant host. The location is easily reached from the interstate, and very convenient to the historical main street of Dickinson, and the various cafes and restaurants there.
I had a very pleasant stay and a good rest.
Urja's place is just as advertised - clean, quiet, comfy and in a good location. Communication was good, check-in was easy. Would also recommend Phat Fish Brewery, which is close by.
Things were exactly as described. The home was clean, cozy, and a pleasant stay.
Urja's home is lovely - relaxing, clean, and beautiful. She is a wonderful, welcoming host. We enjoyed our stay in her home very much, and would definitely recommend her place!
Nice digs, gracious host, and a cool dog. Thank you!

I stayed for a night with a friend, on a road trip, after we visited TRNP and on our way to Fargo. The room was extremely comfy, and Urja put out a luxurious high air mattress for me so that we could each have our own bed. Urja herself is lovely and helpful. Would absolutely stay again!
Comfortable and efficient place to stay while passing through this surprisingly enjoyable town. We had a great time, thanks Urja.
A nice, clean place to stay!
Beautiful, well kept home where your room and bathroom are immaculate and have all the things you need. Great communication with host.
Super cute home with comfy bed and friendly host and dog. Highly recommend and would stay again!
Nice new home and a very comfortable stay. Urja is super friendly and accommodating.
the room is very clean, I only stayed for one night but I enjoyed it

Urja is a gracious hostess. She includes thoughtful little things like a bottle of water next the bed. Notes of welcome. Scented lotion in the bathroom.
The bed is very comfortable & I slept well. Her home is dog friendly with a fenced yard. I stayed with her twice… so far.
Wonderful spot, wonderful host. Would stay again! Definitely one of the better air bnb Experiences I’ve had
Great location. Comfortable stay!
Urja’s place was very inviting and cozy and a great place to settle in for the night with a bunch of great local stuff to check out nearby!

This was a great place to stay overnight in Dickinson. Urja and her pup were friendly and made me feel right at home. Off-street parking was right by the front door, the area was very safe, the bed was comfortable, Wi-Fi was fast, and the bathroom was nicely appointed. I also really appreciated how close to the Enchanted Highway this place was. I would definitely stay here again.

Urja is a gracious hostess. Her home is fresh & clean. She includes thoughtful extras like scented toiletries & a bottle of water in your room. The bed is very comfortable. My dogs were so happy to play in the snow & run in the fenced back yard.
Sparkling clean and cozy place! Cute dogs and good conversations with the host. Urja also provided me with breakfast. Best Airbnb experience I have had for a while. 😍
Comfy bed and great location. Urja was very friendly!
Urja’s house is cozy and perfect. I look forward to staying there again!
We enjoyed our stay while visiting Medora. Urja is a nice host and had everything we needed for our visit. If we are ever in the area again, we'll look out for her posting!
Comfortable bed room with adjacent nice bathroom and a charming hostess! So glad she was open to having our dog and our girl got along well with her friendly chihuahua. We enjoyed our stay at Urja’s!
Nice place. Clean and convenient. Would definitely stay there again.

Thank you so much for hosting us and for your gift of the pie, it was delicious! This is a great Airbnb to rent if you are planning on visiting Theodore Roosevelt National Park. We were about 20-25 minutes to the South Unit, (less than that to Painted Canyon), and about an hour from the North Unit. You're also quite close to gas and the main restaurant in town. We stayed quite warm despite the cold temps and snow outside. If you are someone who likes to cook / eat at home, be able to do laundry on your trip, this is the perfect place.
Very nice and comfortable place. Andrea was quick to respond and offered to help if we had any special needs.
Andrea's place was very clean and comfortable. She communicated well and amenities were great. Would definitely recommend and stay again.
comfy place to stay

The first thing that stood out when we opened the door was how fresh and clean it was. Andrea was super responsive with the couple of questions that we had. We couldn’t have asked for a better experience in a stay. I recommend this place 100%.
The town of Belfield is perfect as a base for going to Theodore Rosevelt NP as it is the exit for the North loop of the park and the south is an easy 20 min drive. Make sure you stop for groceries before you get here since Dollar General is it.
The only thing that we ran into was that restaurants that were supposed to be open in Belfield and in Medora were not. Just make sure you plan accordingly for dinner. This was only an issue because we were there after season. If you go in season, you shouldn’t have a problem.

Clean, comfortable, convenient location to visit both North and South units of the National Park. Very basic, bring your own water and shampoo, conditioner, soap, etc and earplugs for sleeping if wind whipping through the thin walls would keep you awake.
Nice place with lots of elbow room. Having three bedrooms and two bathrooms was great, and a full size, well stocked kitchen was nice. Easy checkin/checkout with no hassles or problems. Great value.

This is a mobile home, but very well maintained, clean and comfortable. We felt safe and had everything we needed for our 3 night stay. The town of Belfield is currently not very vibrant, but the location is close to Medora, and there is plenty of restaurants and activities there. We visited both units of the Roosevelt National Park and this Air Bnb was very convenient to both locations. Andrea responded quickly to my difficulty figuring out how to access wifi, and all was well after that.
Recommend highly if planning to visit TRNP and Medora.
Very clean and comfortable. Plenty of space. Quiet and private. Great location for visiting Theodore Roosevelt NP.
We enjoyed our stay. The home was clean and comfortable with plenty of space for the three of us to enjoy both shared activities and privacy. It was a quick drive to Medora.

The Miller Cabin is a very pretty, clean and comfortable rental! There is not a grocery store within 19 miles so come prepared or shop at the Dollar General! We loved that there was a washer and dryer! That was so helpful on our 12 days trip! We would stay here again!

Great location for visiting both units of Theodore Roosevelt National Park. Clean, comfortable. spacious place was nice to come back to after long days exploring. Quiet, small town with gas, good restaurant, and groceries 2 minutes away. Host was responsive and very pleasant.
We spent a couple days in Mendora, this was a great place to stay and close to everything we did. It was nice to go back at the end of the day and feel at home.
Great place to stay if you plan on visiting both the northern and southern units of TRNP.
Very good location to visit Theodore Roosevelt National Park. Very spacious and had everything we needed. I would stay here again.
Very clean. Perfect spot to explore TRNP. Place was well- stocked and comfortable
Good place to stay near the Badlands. 20 minutes from the park. The place was clean, simple and comfortable.

Had everything we needed and was perfect to relax in after long days of driving and hiking. Andrea's place has a great location for access to both the north and south units of Teddy Roosevelt NP. It was clean, well provisioned, and seemed pretty new. I would definitely stay here again if I'm in the area.

Belfield is a blue-collar town and this BNB is a blue-collar accommodation, which is exactly what I was expecting based on the pictures and the price I paid. The BNB is a double-wide mobile home. I've been in single-wide and double-wide mobile homes before but none as nice as this one. The place looks brand new on the inside and it was immaculate when we got there. And I couldn't believe how spacious it was inside. The floors were solid (no creaks or squeaks) and it felt like you were walking on a slab foundation. Great amenities. This place is a long way from home for me and my wife and I were on a once-in-a-lifetime vacation, so I don't think we'll be in the area again but if I find myself in Belfield again, I would definitely stay at this BNB!

Andrea was very responsive. Her place was easy to find and very spacious. The kitchen was very well stocked with the needed essentials. We enjoyed the fireworks that the neighbors sit off as our stay was the weekend leading up to the Fourth of July.
The location was perfect for the T. Roosevelt National Park. The town is small but a great steakhouse, and we even went to the community dinner in town. Andrea was very responsive.
Everything was great! House was clean and communication was great

Perfect home base for our family while we explored Theodore Roosevelt National Park. Location is great for access to both South and North units, as well as access to Dickinson with wider variety of groceries and restaurants.
The floor plan was great for us, and the kitchen amenities were just what we needed for meal time.
Washer and dryer were lifesavers for us after long dusty hikes with kiddos!
Clean, comfortable, and quiet with the perfect location to explore both the north and south units of Theodore Roosevelt National Park.
Had great time, would do it again
I would stay here again in a heart beat. Awesome place and awesome people.

My first time in North Dakota, exactly what I was looking for. They were extremely helpful in helping me find everything I needed for my stay. House was spotless! Would highly recommend to anyone looking at staying there!
Another great stay! So peaceful and quiet here! Kids didn’t want to leave! This is a beautiful place to enjoy by yourselves or with family.
The cabin was perfect. SPOTLESS! Beautiful views and close to town and the park. We were greeted by horses and deer each morning. Would definitely recommend!
Very nice accommodations. Had everything we needed and more!
This is my second time staying here, still amazing

We had 3 1/2 days to wander both the TRNP’s. Such beauty and ruggedness. We saw the wild horses in the S and bison in the N. Plus, discovering Medora was a treat. Great shopping, friendly people and wonderful restaurants.
There is nothing we wanted for at Davis Creek Cabin. There were plenty of dishes, pots/pans, towels, clean linens and the views were extraordinary! The house was just “comfortable and inviting”. We lacked for nothing and our hosts were available whenever we had a question. Highly recommend this destination!!!!
Great place! We just loved it and everything about it. It is private, clean, quiet. We enjoyed the kitties, the views and the great retreat! Thank you!

Far & above the most amazing place we have stayed in Medora. The equine facilities were top notch, the views are breathtaking, and the setting is peaceful. We rode right out of the yard and accessed the Maah Daah Hey trail very close by as well. Roger is flexible and responsive. A true peace of heaven!

We’ve been to Medora multiple times and this is by far our favorite place we’ve stayed! Short drive from town, the national park, and the musical. And nothing beats the view, peacefulness & the hominess the Davis creek cabin provided! We give it 5 stars from our age range of 19 months all the way up to age 63!
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Davis Creek Ranch. A peaceful location with beautiful views and close to town. The cabin was cozy and we felt right at home!

We enjoyed our stay at the Davis Creek Cabin. Medora and the South Unit of TRNP were easily accessible, but it was so nice to feel away from the tourist spots and immersed in the Badlands scenery. The kitchen was very well equipped and the accommodations were very comfortable for our family of 6. Our boys loved checking out the animals on the property as well. I would recommend this cabin to anyone looking to explore TRNP and Medora!
Roger's place was absolutely wonderful! Very well laid out and furnished. Great views and beautiful surroundings. About a 15 minute drive to Medora. Had a great stay!

We absolutely LOVED Roger’s cabin. Highly recommend. It was pure magic and we got to see lots of wildlife. Very private and secluded which was perfect for us and what we prefer. The cabin inside was adorable and very clean.
Thank you Roger for letting us stay and we hope to come back!
The house is very homey and comfortable. The property is private yet close enough to town that we didn't need to drive a long ways to get to the things we wanted to see and do.

The setting of where the cabin is located makes you feel like you're in the Badlands!!! The scenery is unbelievable and so peaceful. You are on a working ranch.
10 min drive, give or take on back roads to Medora.
The western decorations give you that true Western experience.
I would definitely recommend this place.
Roger is an excellent host!!!!!

Beautiful setting for a cabin and the cabin itself was beautiful! Very private location, but with a view of horses and cattle on the property and georgeous views of Theodore Roosevelt State Park.
The host responded so quickly; I barely had to send a message and had one back. House was spotless and well-equipped.
Ideal location for anyone wanting a relaxing vacation out of the way from tourists or road noise.
Responsive and nice host. Beautiful location.

The photos didn’t do this cabin or location justice! The cabin was peaceful, cozy and very clean. Rodger communicated everything we needed to know in a timely manner and was very friendly during our stay. We have been to Medora several times now, and this has been by far our favorite place to stay at!
Perfect little cabin. The location is amazing. The cabin is comfortable and high quality. I highly recommend this space over anything in medora. Looking forward to staying again.

This is a perfect spot to spend your time in the Badlands. A short drive south of Medora and you are living in the Badlands, not just visiting. Clean, well-appointed home that has something for everyone of all ages. Easy access in and out. We hope to return!

This was a perfect location for this area. The cabin was comfortable and the host had everything you needed. The view was fantastic and the mother cows and calves were really playful in the morning. It was fun to watch them.
We had a wonderful stay. It was so nice to come back to this great cabin after a hot day of exploring the area. Beautiful setting, but still is a close drive to town. Will come back again!

A perfectly perfect country stay! The house was immaculately clean, as described to the T, and amazingly quiet and peaceful. To boot , it was the most well furnished kitchen I’ve ever seen. I would have no hesitation recommending a stay - 10 out of 10. Try it out, you’ll love it :)

Our family stayed here for four nights and we highly enjoyed it! The cabin had everything we needed and then some, plus the views were spectacular. We also loved how it was convenient to get to Medora and the national park but we were still able to enjoy some privacy away from the other tourists. Definitely a great place to stay - thank you for sharing it with us!

We stayed here 4 nights. All comforts of home and then some. So enjoyed the coziness and peaceful views. Great time disconnecting and spending time with family unwinding from high pace life. Great location convenient to parks and charming Medora.

Well furnished, spacious and well-stocked with amenities. The cabin was in in a beautiful setting. Our additional guests stated that they would like to come back. Roughly 20 minutes from Medora itself but a nice escape from the Summer tourists in town.

We couldn't be happier with our stay at the Davis Creek cabin. The cabin was very comfortable and adequately stocked with essentials to make our stay enjoyable.
